newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Air Ukraine to choose Boeing or Airbus next week.
newsitem.headline: Air Ukraine to choose Boeing or Airbus next week.

text.p: Ukraine will decide next week whether U.S. planemaker Boeing Corp or Europe's Airbus Industrie will win a tender to replace Air Ukraine's ageing fleet, a senior government official said on Friday.
"The final choice is expected next week. A very serious decision is coming, and many important things will be finally decided," the official, who asked not to be named, told Reuters.
First Deputy Prime Minister Vasyl Durdynets said on Thursday that Air Ukraine could go for a compromise deal with both aircraft manufacturers.
"A compromise can be found by taking into account that Air Ukraine needs both long-rang and middle-range planes," Durdynets was quoted by new agencies as saying on Thursday.
The state-owned flagship carrier wants to lease or buy planes for existing Transatlantic routes to New York and Toronto, and for planned routes to Chicago, Miami and Los Angeles.

Boeing has proposed selling one long-range 767 model and one mid-range 737-300. Airbus has proposed leasing two long-range A-310-300 and one mid-range A-320-200 this year, and selling its newly-designed long-range A-330-200 in 1999.

Air Ukraine has nine Illyushin-62 planes, 30 Tupolev-134 and -154 jets, 30 Yakovlev-40 and -42s, and 64 Antonov-24s -- but some of them are not flying because of their age, as well as reductions in passengers.
Last month Air Ukraine said the tender would be finalised by mid-January.
